Title: Get Revisions
DescriptionLines: When **Revisions** are enabled, a revision for a document will be created upon:
* Modifying document body
* Modifying document metadata
* Adding or removing attachments
* Creating or deleting counters
The revisions created for a document can be retrieved from the server.

Walkthroughs.Title: Enable revisions
DescriptionLines: * Document revisions are Not enabled by default.
* The above code will enable the revisions feature for _all_ the database collections.
* Learn more in the _Enable Revisions Demo_.

Walkthroughs.Title: Modify a document
DescriptionLines: * Make any needed modifications to your document.
* Per each call to `SaveChanges()`, the document is saved in the database.
A revision with the document's current content will be created on the server if content is different than what exists on the database.
* The above example will generate 2 new revisions for document 'companies/7-A'.
One with only a Name change, and one with a Name & Phone change.

Walkthroughs.Title: Get the revisions created
DescriptionLines: * Use the advanced method `GetFor()` to get all revisions created.
Use the advanced method `GetMetadataFor()` to get the revisions metadata.
* Specific revisions can be fetched by their change-vector, or by a specific date.
Learn more in the online documentation.
* The 'revisions' variable will contain a list of revisions for document 'companies/7-A'
(with body content, not metadata).
* Note: The revision content itself cannot be modified on the server.
